name: St. Demetrius of Thessalonica
summary: Demetrius was a Christian martyr who died in Thessalonica during the Diocletian persecution. According to tradition, he was a Roman soldier who converted to Christianity and was martyred for his faith. He is one of the most important Orthodox military saints and is the patron saint of Thessalonica. He is often depicted as a soldier on horseback and is invoked for protection in battle.
